<NEW - WHEELIE>

WHEELIE was lost over in co=
ntemplation.  The DINOBOTS had never been openly hostile to other Autobots,=
 and thsi would have transferred over to MAXIMALS as well in theory.  But h=
e had not heard from his friends mostly since the end of the GREAT WAR.  Wh=
at had changed in that period of time that had shifted?  From the mere snip=
pets of stories he had heard, it did not sound as if the DINOBOTS had been =
reprogramed in any such way.

Much less literally a full scale assault over=
 upon a shuttle, an act which he could not fathom them doing.  Either they =
were not control of their own shells, they were merely lookalikes in some w=
ay..  Or something horrible had happened the likes of which he could not ia=
mgine.

Getting static over from his communicator and not able to pick up a=
nything beyond visual range on his scanners, he could not leave here to sea=
rch for anyone without the possibility of going through thousands of kilome=
ters of rainforest in random directions with no guarantee of finding anyone=
.

WHEELIE paused quietly, and as he lsitened to the two, he took out a sma=
ll datapadd, and on it he began taking notes.  Of MAGMATRON, of SABREBACK. =
 Of this small outpost out in the middle of nowhere.  Of the incapacitated =
RODIMUS.  Of the escapees who were hiding.  Writing it to try and make it m=
ake sense.  Using an old Quintesson binary sequencing which was obvious eno=
ugh to anyone who knew the language, but he didn't expect many Maximals of =
this era who were not historians to have had any encounters with it, which =
made it safe enough to record his thoughts in.

Glancing over at the group =
as they came out, he said simply, "We wait.  Eventually, things will abate.=
"
